poem:
**Inertia**

In the quiet classroom of my youth,  
Newton whispered solace to the awkward,  
force equaling mass times acceleration,  
a promise of order in a chaotic world.  
Even now, when burnout flickers in my shadow,  
I see the gentle arc of equations  
bending everything—body, mind—  
toward a placid equilibrium.
